intro: Manglietia sabahensis, commonly known as the Sabah manglietia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in late winter. The plant has broad, leathery leaves and produces woody capsules as its fruit. It is typically found in lowland and hill dipterocarp forests, growing as an understory shrub. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
